file_content.text: I wouldn't linger down here. There's no telling what the Justicars might do next.
Shipping records from the Justicar docks. This should be everything you need.
Couldn't have done it better myself. These records prove the Justicars are getting supplies from offworld.
I'll transmit these to headquarters, let them chew on it awhile. You've got my thanks.
Once I have proof the Justicars are breaking the law, we can take action.
Traveling together, that's smart. Only way to win down here is through numbers.
Master Jedi. Don't see too many of you on Coruscant anymore. Certainly not in Justicar territory.
Better watch your weapons, Lieutenant. Everyone's desperate for them in Justicar territory.
Welcome to Justicar territory, citizen. Nice to see a friendly face.
Agent Reid Gandon, Strategic Information Service. Notice anything odd down here? Like how quickly the Justicars took control?
Weapons and armor don't just materialize out of thin air. The Justicars have a supplier, and it isn't the Republic. You follow?
You suspect the Justicars of illegal trade?
I think so.
And worse. Black market goods are one thing, but trading with the Empire is treason.
You sound like you have your suspicions.
You mean the Empire?
The Justicars were supposedly formed by Republic citizens. Fear and martial law's not how the Republic operates.
Where else can the Justicars get what they need?
Like who?
If not legally from the Republic, there's a few options--the Exchange, separatists, even the Empire.
Maybe you should let Republic security in on your little theory.
Tell it to the authorities.
As ruthless as they've become, the Justicars are keeping the Black Sun at bay. So, Republic security won't move on this without proof.
Not really.
The Justicars are too well equipped for a volunteer militia. I think there's more to their story than keeping the peace.
I don't have time for riddles.
Whoever's got the weapons runs the show. The SIS needs to know where those supplies are coming from.
The Justicars control their own shipping dock, and I'm sure they keep records. I just need someone who can handle an ambush to get them.
Storming the docks might make the Justicars suspicious.
Is there a quieter way?
If there were another way, I'd be topside and long gone by now.
You found one.
Get those records to me as soon as you find them. You don't want to get waylaid by the Justicars.
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
I wouldn't linger. As long as the Justicars are running things, this area isn't safe.
Watch yourself, friend. This place isn't as safe as the Justicars say.
